### Initialize a Git repository

1. If needed, navigate to the project folder using the command line.
1. Initialize a new Git repository in the project folder.

### Add content and commit changes

3. Create a new text file and name it appropriately.
4. Add a *short* entry to the text file (any favorite or an intriguing AI-generated one).
5. Stage the new file.
6. Commit the changes in the text file with a descriptive commit message.

:rocket: Optional: Commit at least three additional changes in your new file.
